## Tender Announcement

### National Individual Standing Offer for Compact LASER/LIDAR Speed-Measuring Equipment

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) has issued a national individual standing offer for the provision of compact LASER/LIDAR speed-measuring equipment to enforce vehicle speed regulations across Canada.

**Submission Details**

* **Reference Number**: cb-6477-39689749
* **Amendment Number**: 7
* **Solicitation Number**: A/202200845
* **Publication Date**: 2023-06-15
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-08-09T14:00:00

**Background**

The RCMP has identified a need for compact LASER speed-measuring equipment to support operational requirements. This standing offer is for the provision of compact LASER devices, which differ from standard LASER speed-measuring equipment.

**Scope of Work**

The scope of work includes the delivery of the required services to identified users across Canada, including areas subject to Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs). The contract duration will be one year from the issuance of the standing offer, with three additional extension periods of one year each.

**Selection Criteria**

The selection criteria for this tender are mandatory technical criteria only. Offers must comply with the requirements outlined in the standing offer and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be considered responsive. The responsive offer with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for issuance of a standing offer.

**Submission Requirements**

Tenders must be submitted to the RCMP Bid Receiving Unit at anouk.st-aubin@rcmp-grc.gc.ca, along with any required documentation. Further information can be obtained by referring to the attached tender documents.

**Note**

This standing offer is subject to the Ta'an Kwach'an Council Final Agreement, Tsawwassen First Nation Final Agreement, and Kwanlin Dun First Nation Final Agreement. All deliverables must be received within 14 calendar days from receipt of a call-up against the standing offer.

**Integrity Regime**

The RCMP has adopted the Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada. As a result, the integrity provisions are being applied in RCMP contracting activities. Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The RCMP has adopted the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Businesses.
